document_title: Grade 1 fatty liver: Causes, signs and treatments
subsection_content:
Fatty liver is a condition in which excess fat accumulates in the liver. Fat index accounts for 5-10% of liver weight, this is considered level 1 fatty liver. At this level, excess fat is only concentrated on the outer surface of the liver and does not really affect the function of the liver. liver function.
Level 1 fatty liver disease usually does not cause many health concerns, and can be cured if the patient follows the doctor's advice on a healthy lifestyle, especially a reasonable diet.
At level 1, excess fat in the liver is still at a low level on the liver surface
